title: Hardest Combo Mechanic in the game?
body:
For a long time, I thought it'd have to be Alistar's Wombo + Qombo....

But I have to say, Azir's W + E + Q instant-soldier-chase combo is even harder.

Any other contenders? I heard Zed has a crazy-hard R + W + Q combo or something. What's the hardest combo mechanic to pull off that you know of?

replies.body:
ali combo is piss easy, its 100% reliant on ping tho.

azir combo was fine during free week, but didnt it just get slightly changed? making it slightly harder?

RWQ zed? so triple Q landing? that can be situationally hard im sure.

imho the hardest combo in the game is pulling off a flash tibbers. so hard, such skill.
oh wait, RQQ or QRQ or QQR or any of the lee sin combos, such skill needed. chollanga skills.
Actually Getting the right Ryze combo down for max damage can get annoying.

Personally i think a full Jayce combo is pretty hard to pull of correctly, quickly and consistently. I'm talking bout a Q -> E -> W -> R -> W -> Q -> E combo. Trying to pull that off in that order as quickly as possible is difficult.
im sorry pls explain which form u start off with
Start Cannon form (why would you Q>E>W in hammer form?)

It's actually not all that hard once you play him often enough, once you have it down though, it becomes a great talent for laning and for team fighting.

also as a note, if your not R>W>Q>AA>E then your also doing that combo wrong :P

I would have to say the hardest combos to pull off on champions, would be a 'good' Insec Kick on Lee Sin, and Jayce's full combo (Not just ball + gate).

A good insec is hard to pull off, whether you want to disposition the enemy's carry, or create a 5 man team knock up on the enemy for your team to follow up on; takes a lot of practice and quick thinking to know when you can and can't go in, who to kick and much more.

I don't play Jayce that much, but from the few times that I have, I know his full combo is a difficult one to pull off without just rolling my hand on the keyboard.

There are many other champions who's combos could be considered hard to do({{champion:268}}), but these are just the ones that I find the trickiest in the book.
leblanc

lee sin Q onto frontline.
Follow up Q, Ward jump to middle of the team.
Ult the carry then flash to direct them into your team.
Win fight/game.

The Zed 3 Qs are hard.
Otherwise, Azir is one of the hardest champions to use his combo.
try out yis' combo, i still can't master it.

I find it hard to press Q and AA.

:/
wait.. you're meant to press q on yi? wtf nobody told me -_-

Lee Sin's Q->Q, Ult->flash, wardjump->E.
Very useful, however you normally get cc'd after ult-flashing.

Lee Sin

Q -> wardjump -> Ult -> Q.

Not amazingly hard, but w/e Most combos are pretty easy.

Try do fiddles R + DFG + E + Q + Zhonya into the whole enemy team without being blown up and record it pls, I want to see it happen.

I always fail, and I'm not sure if it's just because I'm bad or it's too much to try and do before popping zhonya.
it sounds to me like your ping is to blame dude, i can do that without an issue, and i am by no means bragging and i'm not a pro either, it takes a whole 2 seconds if not less
I'd have to say I find the hardest one is Maokai W-Q, since his Q pushes enemies the wrong way if used immediately after W.

Any combo that requires active items, i just cant seem to press them and get my fingers back to where they should be mid fight, and if i use the buttons on my mouse, when i get a fright i clench my hand and whoops zhonya's ect. 

with Azir's soldier chase combo it isn't so much hard as fast, its easy to do but you have to be quick about it 

personally i find Elise's combo hard, I'm probably wrong here but its something like:
E (skillshot), Q, W (skillshot away from target) R, E ,W, Q, or something like that, i cant even remember the damn thing in game hahahaha

This game requires you to use roughly 13 buttons. QWER being your main 4. 

It isn't hard to execute combos. It's harder know when to do them.
